concept.title: Intro to Computer Parts
concept.shortdesc: This topic provides an overview of the main hardware components inside a typical personal computer.

conbody.p: The information in this document explains the components of a computer and what they do.

section.title: Central Processing Unit (CPU)
section.p: The CPU is often called the brain of the computer. CPU's manage the information within the computer and directs the information to where it should go.

section.title: CPU Cooler
section.p: CPU Coolers are components, in the form of metal blocks with copper piping, that attach to motherboards on top of the CPU. CPU Coolers cool CPUs.

section.title: Motherboard
section.p: After other components of a computer are attached to a motherboard, those components and the motherboard itself can transfer information from one part to another.

section.title: Random Access Memory (RAM)
section.p: RAM reads, stores, and changes data. RAM reads/writes are incredibly fast compared to Storage Drives.

section.title: Storage Drives
section.p: Storage drives store data that can be directly accessed by users.

section.title: Power Supply Unit (PSU)
section.p: Power supplies input power from an outlet and provide power to the computer.

section.title: Graphics Processing Unit (GPU)
section.p: GPUs are sometimes referred to as graphics or video cards. Graphics cards allow computers to show information on an external display, like a monitor.

section.title: Case
section.p: Computer cases house all other internal components.
